articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Pakistan said India fired missiles at three air bases early on Saturday including one close to the capital, Islamabad, but Pakistani air defences intercepted most of them as the neighbours extended their worst fighting in nearly three decades.
articles.title: Pakistan says three air bases targeted by Indian missiles

articles.author: Alina Smutko, Herbert Villarraga
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin has declared a three-day pause in fighting against Ukraine, but for bloodied Ukrainian soldiers limping into a field hospital, their wounds testified that the ceasefire was not being respected.
articles.title: Wounded Ukrainian soldiers ask: What ceasefire?

articles.author: Andrew Mills, Jonathan Landay
articles.description: A Qatari mission has begun searching for the remains of U.S. hostages killed by Islamic State in Syria a decade ago, two sources briefed on the mission said, reviving a longstanding effort to recover their bodies.
articles.title: Exclusive: Qataris search for bodies of Americans killed by Islamic State in Syria

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia would require a halt to U.S. and European arms supplies to Ukraine during any potential ceasefire, Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said in an interview with ABC News.
articles.title: Russia says Western arms flows to Ukraine would need to stop during any ceasefire

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's vice premier He Lipeng held talks with U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent early on Saturday in Geneva, China's state-owned news agency Xinhua reported.
articles.title: China-US trade talks begin in Geneva

articles.author: Kanishka Singh
articles.description: The U.S. government said it offered assistance to make India and Pakistan start "constructive talks" while the Group of Seven (G7) major countries also urged the Asian neighbors to engage in direct dialogue amid heightened hostilities.
articles.title: US offers to help India and Pakistan start talks, G7 also urges dialogue

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen on Saturday backed a proposed unconditional 30-day ceasefire in the Russian war in Ukraine and said that the EU was ready to impose more sanctions on Russia if a ceasefire is breached.
articles.title: EU Commission chief says bloc ready to impose more sanctions on Russia if ceasefire breached

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A diver died on Friday during preliminary operations to recover British tech tycoon Mike Lynch's superyacht from the waters off the coast of northern Sicily, local police said.
articles.title: Diver dies in preliminary operations to recover Lynch's yacht

articles.author: Karen Lema, Devjyot Ghoshal
articles.description: In political rallies, Senate hearings and voter surveys ahead of Monday's midterm elections in the Philippines, China has been an overwhelming - and unusual - presence.
articles.title: China takes centre stage in Philippines' feisty midterm election

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Two loud blasts were heard in Indian's Kashmir's summer capital of Srinagar on Saturday, near the city airport and the local headquarters of the army, according to an official, a Reuters witness, and local residents.
articles.title: Blasts heard in Indian Kashmir's Srinagar, say official, Reuters witness, residents
